guide.title: User Guide
guide.intro: Learn how to use the app effectively to manage your products and prevent waste.
guide.scanDesc: Tap the scan button on the home screen, point the camera at the barcode, and the product will be added automatically.
guide.manualDesc: Tap "Add item without barcode" to enter product details manually.
guide.dateDesc: After scanning or manual entry, select an expiry date using the date picker.
guide.categoriesDesc: Create categories to organize your products. Tap "Categories" in the settings menu.
guide.locationsDesc: Assign products to different locations (e.g., fridge, warehouse) to track them easily.
guide.listsDesc: View all products or only expired products in the "All" and "Expired" tabs.
guide.notificationsDesc: Enable notifications to receive daily reminders before products expire.
guide.reminderDesc: Set how many days in advance to receive an alert. You can choose between 0-30 days.
guide.autoDeleteDesc: Set automatic deletion of expired products after a number of days (1-15 days).
guide.csvDesc: Export all your products to a CSV file for use in Excel or other spreadsheets.
guide.pdfDesc: Create a professional PDF report of all your products with expiry dates and categories.
guide.swipeDesc: Swipe a product left in the list to delete it or mark it as resolved.
guide.refreshDesc: Pull down on the product list to refresh data from the server.
guide.searchDesc: Use the search field to quickly find specific products in the list.
guide.profileDesc: Update your business details, view your subscription, and contact support from the "Settings" screen.

terms.intro2: Using the App constitutes acceptance of all the terms described in this document. If you do not agree – do not use the App.

terms.section1Body2: The App is not a substitute for checking expiry dates in reality and does not take full responsibility for the accuracy of the data.
terms.section2Bullet1: Responsibility for checking the actual expiry dates is solely on them.
terms.section2Bullet2: Errors, delays or inaccuracies may occur in the displayed expiry or notifications.
terms.section2Bullet3: The App is not responsible for any direct or indirect damage resulting from use of the data.
terms.section3Bullet3: Additional permissions depending on future features
terms.section3Body2: Refusing permissions may limit some services.
terms.section4Body1: All information the user enters is stored in the Supabase cloud.
terms.section4Body2: The user is responsible for not entering misleading, offensive or illegal content.
terms.section5Bullet1: Modify, copy, duplicate or distribute the App without permission.
terms.section5Bullet2: Attempt to access the source code, database or servers.
terms.section5Bullet3: Use the App for malicious purposes.
terms.section6Body1: In cases of prohibited use or breach of these terms, the developer may block access or delete an account.
terms.section7Body1: The terms may be updated from time to time.
terms.section7Body2: Continued use constitutes acceptance of the updated terms.
terms.section8Body1: For any questions, you can contact the email address listed in the App.

permission.iosTitle: How to enable camera access on iOS:
permission.iosSteps:
1. Tap the "Open Settings" button below
2. Scroll down and select "ExpiryX"
3. Tap "Camera"
4. Select "Allow"
5. Return to the app
permission.androidTitle: How to enable camera access on Android:
permission.androidSteps:
1. Tap the "Open Settings" button below
2. Select "Apps" > "ExpiryX"
3. Go to "Permissions"
4. Tap "Camera" and select "Allow"
5. Return to the app
